page.title: 01Hittisleigh
page.content: This rural area on the northern fringe of Dartmoor lies mainly within the 2 parishes of Cheriton Bishop and Hittisleigh. It is bisected from SW to NE by a steep-sided wooded valley through which flows the river Yeo. The roads are narrow lanes bordered by banks and hedges with field gateways providing passing places for traffic. All mains electricity and telephones are supplied by overhead cables supported on wooden poles. There is one small centre of population at the hamlet of Hittisleigh which has the only street lighting in the area. The rest of the population is very scattered. The total number of buildings is 1 church, 1 chapel, 18 farms with buildings, 2 derelict farmhouses, 48 other properties, 1 car scrapyard and a building material depot.
